intro: Sabicea domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican sabicea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
